wolk.interfaces package¶

wolk.ActuationHandler module¶

class wolk.interfaces.ActuationHandler.ActuationHandler[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Handle actuation commands received from WolkAbout IoT platform.

handle_actuation(reference, value)[source]¶

Set actuator to value.

When the actuation command is given from the platform, it will be delivered to this method. This method should pass the new value to the device’s actuator. Must be implemented as non blocking. Must be implemented as thread safe.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the actuator
  • value (int or float or str) – Value to which to set the actuator

wolk.ActuatorStatusProvider module¶

class wolk.interfaces.ActuatorStatusProvider.ActuatorStatusProvider[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Read the status of device’s actuators.

get_actuator_status(reference)[source]¶

Get current actuator status.

Reads the status of actuator from the device and returns it as a tuple containing the ActuatorState and current value. Must be implemented as non blocking. Must be implemented as thread safe.

Parameters:reference (str) – Actuator reference
Returns:(state, value)
Return type:(wolk.models.ActuatorState.ActuatorState, int or float or str)

wolk.ConfigurationHandler module¶

class wolk.interfaces.ConfigurationHandler.ConfigurationHandler[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Set device’s configuration options.

handle_configuration(configuration)[source]¶

Change device’s configuration options.

When the configuration command is given from the platform, it will be delivered to this method. This function should update device configuration with received configuration values. Must be implemented as non blocking. Must be implemented as thread safe.

Parameters:configuration (dict) – Configuration option reference:value pairs

wolk.ConfigurationProvider module¶

class wolk.interfaces.ConfigurationProvider.ConfigurationProvider[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Read the device’s current configuration options.

get_configuration()[source]¶

Get current configuration options.

Reads device configuration and returns it as a dictionary with device configuration reference as key, and device configuration value as value.

Must be implemented as non blocking. Must be implemented as thread safe.

Returns:configuration
Return type:dict

wolk.ConnectivityService module¶

class wolk.interfaces.ConnectivityService.ConnectivityService[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Enable communication with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

connect()[source]¶

Connect to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnect from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

publish(outbound_message)[source]¶

Publish a message to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Returns true on success, false otherwise.

Parameters:outbound_message (wolk.models.OutboundMessage.OutboundMessage) – Message to send
Returns:success
Return type:bool
set_inbound_message_listener(listener)[source]¶

Set a callback to WolkConnect._on_inbound_message method.

callback function passes back an wolk.models.InboundMessage.InboundMessage object.

Parameters:listener (wolk.WolkConnect.WolkConnect) – WolkConnect instance

Responsible for handling the installation of the firmware file.

Handle the installation of the firmware file.

wolk.FirmwareHandler module¶

class wolk.interfaces.FirmwareHandler.FirmwareHandler[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Handle firmware update process.

Implement this class to write and read files in persistent memory, persist firmware version and handle the process of installation of firmware file itself. Optionally provide implementation for URL download

persist_version(version)[source]¶

Place the current firmware version into persistent storage.

Later to be used to determine the result of the firmware update process

Parameters:version (str) – The current firmware version
Returns:result
Return type:bool
read_chunk(index)[source]¶

Read a chunk of the temporary firmware file.

Parameters:index (int) – offset from the beginning of the file
Returns:chunk
Return type:bytes
set_url_download_result_callback(callback)[source]¶

Set the callback function for reporting the result of URL file download.

Parameters:callback (function) – function to call
unpersist_version()[source]¶

Remove the firmware version from persistent storage.

Returns:version
Return type:str or None
update_abort()[source]¶

Abort the process of firmware update.

update_finalize()[source]¶

Finish the process of firmware update.

update_start(file_name, file_size)[source]¶

Start receiving the firmware file.

Parameters:
  • file_name (str) – name of the firmware file
  • file_size (int) – size of the firmware file in bytes
Returns:

result
Return type:

bool
update_start_url_download(file_url)[source]¶

Prepare the device for the URL file transfer.

Parameters:file_url (str) – The URL that contains the firmware file
Returns:result
Return type:bool
write_chunk(chunk)[source]¶

Write a chunk of the firmware file to the temporary file.

Parameters:chunk (bytes) – A piece of the firmware file
Returns:result
Return type:bool

wolk.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler module¶

class wolk.interfaces.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Responsible for providing means of downloading firmware file from a URL.

download(url, file, result_callback)[source]¶

Download the resource located at the url to the file.

Return the result of the download process as a bool to result_callback

Parameters:
  • url (str) – URL from where to download the file
  • file (str) – Name of file to which to download
  • result_callback (function) – Function to which to report the outcome
